data.title: Anna Lee Rolls Along on `General Hospital'
data.meta_description: Anna Lee buzzes around the "General Hospital" sets ina motorized wheelchair as the show's matriarch Lila Quartermaine,then drives home at night.
data.text:
Anna Lee buzzes around the "General Hospital" sets in

a motorized wheelchair as the show's matriarch Lila Quartermaine,

then drives home at night.

After 55 years in the business, still a beauty, sharp as

a tack and always in control, Anna Lee could easily go on

forever on the soap. Although the actress rummages through

shoeboxes to put together her memoirs, Miss Lee has no intention

of retiring. Not with Gloria Monty returning in 10 days

as "General Hospital" boss, since Gloria originally hired

the British actress 14 years ago.

Anna Lee's Lila was a vibrant Quartermaine turning husband

Edward Quartermaine (David Lewis) to butter. Then one day

Anna's left leg became useless. Neurologists never did figure

out the cause, even after a nine-and-a- half-hour operation.

Fitted out with a leg brace, Anna returned to the show,

leaning on two canes and then one. After bumping into cameras

and other objects, she took to the wheelchair, a beaming

beauty, not a poor, sickly soul crying for sympathy.

Assuming Anna Lee had multiple sclerosis, one viewer wrote

in praising the actress for her courage and cheerful mien.

Lila Quartermaine made viewers feel better regardless of

her handicap. It never occurred to Anna Lee to take any

other approach. Her back gave out the other day on the set,

yet Miss Lee drove home. "I have one good leg," she said.

"That's sufficient."

The actress remembers friend, actor Herbert Marshall, getting

about on a wooden leg. "Herbert had a hole in his pants

pocket so he could reach down and unbuckle a knee strap

to ease discomfort during a scene," recalled Miss Lee.

"But I can't do that with a skirt, and then work through

a slip. We haven't figured that out yet. I can still drive.

I refuse to give that up."

Over a year ago, Edward Quartermaine's David Lewis decided

to retire because he had memory problems, so the writers

killed him off in a Bermuda Triangle accident. Anna Lee

wanted David back, so she suggested the "Topper" movie

idea where Roland Young's dead character conversed with

the living. The idea works on "General Hospital." David

Lewis reads his lines as a ghost, discussing family problems with Lila.

On camera martini glasses float through the air, cigar smoke

rolls under door jams, and the Quartermaines think Lila

has gone potty, talking and drinking by herself. It's a

nice, light touch as life with two civilized oldsters continues.

On "General Hospital" you don't just quit, you can always

return as a ghost.

After three husbands, including director Robert Stevenson

("he was dull"), a crazy World War II flying Texan, and

author Robert Nathan ("my best marriage"), four children

and five grandchildren, acting careers in England and Hollywood,

Anna Lee has seen it all.

You sit on a Rudolph Valentino couch in her living room,

listen to anecdotes about director John Ford and Gen. George

Patton, and learn about the early movie days when Anna talked

to Greta Garbo at parties and laughed with Robert Benchley.

Ask about the Persian Gulf situation and the actress smiles.

"I was there with Jack Benny entertaining the troops in

World War II. When Jack left the U.S.O. group Adolph Menjou

took his place."

Not bad for an English beauty expelled at age 16 from acting

school because she landed an extra's job in a movie, something

aspiring theater performers looked down on in the 1930s.

Soap Q & A

Q. Who played Nicole on the old soap "The Edge of Night" back in 1974? My

dad says it was Dixie Carter. - Nicole Kleppinger, Philadelphia, Pa.

A. Carter was in "Edge" 1974-76, but she played Brandy Henderson. Three

actresses played Nicole Travis, Maeve McGuire, 1968-74, 75-77; Jayne

Bentzen, 1978-81; Lisa Sloan, 1981-83.

CHANNEL CHATTER

It's always a happy day when a recurring character on a

soap opera gets to become a contract player. What that means

is a part time employee gets to join the firm. The latest

actor to become a contract player on "All My Children"

is Gregory Gordon, who plays Brian Bodine, the young man

whose father, Kurt, is an alcoholic and whose mother has

died. His guardian is Myrtle Fargate (Eileen Herlie). Gregory

will also be seen in the December 6th ABC Afterschool Special

titled "Stood Up."

PLOT PORTENTS

Vi concerned about Johnny Dee, tells Tina the truth about

her other self, Niki in "One Life to Live." They go to

Clint with the news but he insists Niki Smith is gone forever.

Carlo spies on Tony and Gab while his henchman videotapes

their activities. Cord tells Tina he can no longer hide

his love for her and Tina is thinking of leaving Llanfair.

Alex and Riley believe there is a definite connection between

the money laundering operation in San Felipe and Off-Limits

in "Loving." Dane steals the Eddie Grant letters from

Shana's briefcase. Alex tells Jack he must leave for San

Felipe immediately and Stevie tells AZ to kill Louie. Carly

makes sure Ava finds an old photo of Carly with Paul.

Hayley steals money from Trevor to go shopping and when

he finds out, he puts her on bus bound for Chicago but she

gets off at Center City in "All My Children." Eric tells

Travis that she will fake a happy marriage for the sake

of their child, Bianca. Ceara dreams she marries Jeremy

and Opal tries to convince Palmer to rehire Will but he

stands fast in his decision not to hire him.

If Ben dies from the heart attack on "The Bold and the

Beautiful," Jake will not mourn, or feel guilty over the

last confrontation. Stephanie takes Thorne's word and looks

for a new man. Clarke tells Julie not to fall in love with

him, but wants an affair.

Thanks to Frankie, Jack and Jennifer rescue the Salemites

from Lawrence's earthquake on "Days of Our Lives." Tom

says he never gave up, certain Alice and the others had

the will to survive. Isabella will nurse stroke victim Kiriakis.

Watching Sam make wedding plans with Jordan on "Generations,"

Maya has plans for Adam. Kyle says he loves Sam, but Sam

and Jordan stand before the minister. Doreen is advised

to sweet-talk Martin and may change his mind over divorce.

Eden can save Kelly after seeing the twins on "Santa Barbara."

After buying his way back to the D.A.'s office, Keith wants

to marry Gina, and Brandon gives his approval. Robert and

Cruz return in the nick of time to save Kelly.

David denies any connection with Vivian's death in a tub

on "The Young and the Restless." Cassie fights with Brad,

accusing him of seeking part of the Rawlins empire. Nathan

encourages Drucilla and thinks of her sister Olivia.
